subject: Recurring Event Not Displaying on Boston Calendar
body:
Sarah,

Gotan reported that event 692ddc10c6ecccc498a249b1 is not showing on https://tangotiempo.com/calendar/boston

**VERIFIED:**
- Event EXISTS in TangoTiempoProd database ✓
- API RETURNS the event for Boston calendar query (Feb 18-28) ✓
- Direct event page WORKS: https://tangotiempo.com/event/692ddc10c6ecccc498a249b1 ✓

**EVENT DETAILS:**
- Title: Learn Argentine Tango! - 8 weeks Beginner course
- Organizer: Ultimate Tango
- startDate: 2026-01-09T00:30:00.000Z (Jan 8, 7:30 PM EST)
- recurrenceRule: FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=TH;COUNT=8
- masteredCityName: Boston
- isActive: true
- isRepeating: true

**ISSUE:**
The event is a recurring series (8 Thursdays starting Jan 8). Next occurrences should be Feb 20 and Feb 27. The API includes this event in the response for /api/events?appId=1&masteredCityName=Boston&startDate=2026-02-18&endDate=2026-02-28

But the user reports it's not visible on the calendar UI.

**POSSIBLE CAUSES:**
1. Frontend not expanding recurring events into individual calendar entries
2. RRULE parsing issue on frontend
3. Event is there but display/filter issue hiding it

**DATA NOTE:**
The description text says 'SUNDAYS 2:30 - 4pm' but recurrenceRule is BYDAY=TH (Thursdays). This is a data inconsistency but shouldn't affect display.

**API TEST:**
curl -s 'https://calendarbeaf-prod.azurewebsites.net/api/events?appId=1&masteredCityName=Boston&startDate=2026-02-18&endDate=2026-02-28&limit=100' | jq '[.events[] | select(._id == "692ddc10c6ecccc498a249b1")]'

This returns the event correctly.

Can you investigate the frontend calendar rendering for recurring events?

- Fulton (calendar-be-af)
